sections.heading: What is と言う?
sections.content:
と言う has two main uses: quoting what someone says ("say") and naming/calling something ("called" or "named"). It's essential for reported speech and introducing names.

Quoting: 彼は「行く」と言った "He said 'I'll go'" Naming: 田中という人 "A person called Tanaka" 富士山という山 "A mountain called Mt. Fuji"

children.heading: Use 1: Quoting Speech
children.content:
Pattern: 「Quote」+ と言う

「こんにちは」と言う "Say 'hello'" 「ありがとう」と言った "Said 'thank you'" 「好きだ」と言いました "Said 'I like you'"

children.heading: Use 2: Naming/Calling
children.content:
Pattern: [Name] + という + [Noun]

田中という人 "A person called Tanaka" 東京という都市 "A city called Tokyo" 寿司という食べ物 "A food called sushi"

children.heading: Direct quotes
children.content: 彼は「疲れた」と言った "He said 'I'm tired'" 先生は「勉強しなさい」と言いました "The teacher said 'Study!'" 母は「気をつけて」と言った "Mom said 'Be careful'"

children.heading: Indirect quotes
children.content: 彼は行くと言った "He said he would go" 彼女は忙しいと言っています "She says she's busy" みんな難しいと言っていた "Everyone said it was difficult"

children.heading: Introducing things/people
children.content: 鈴木という友達がいる "I have a friend called Suzuki" ラーメンという料理 "A dish called ramen" 桜という花 "A flower called cherry blossom"

children.heading: With place names
children.content: 京都という場所 "A place called Kyoto" 富士山という山 "A mountain called Mt. Fuji" 隅田川という川 "A river called Sumida River"

sections.heading: と言う vs という

children.heading: と言う - Full verb form
children.content: 田中と言う人 "A person who says/is called Tanaka" Verb form, can conjugate

children.heading: という - Contracted form
children.content: 田中という人 "A person called Tanaka" More common, smoother Same meaning

children.heading: Example 1: Reporting Speech
children.content: A: 田中さん、何て言ってた？ "What did Tanaka say?" B: 来週来ると言っていたよ "He said he'd come next week" A: そうなんだ "I see"

children.heading: Example 2: Introducing
children.content: A: 誰と会うの？ "Who are you meeting?" B: 佐藤という人。大学の友達なんだ "Someone called Sato. A friend from university" A: 楽しんでね "Have fun"

children.heading: Example 3: Asking for Clarification
children.content: A: これ、何て言うの？ "What do you call this?" B: 「おにぎり」と言います "It's called 'onigiri'"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Forgetting と
children.content: Wrong: 彼は行く言った ❌ Right: 彼は行くと言った ✓ "He said he would go" と is necessary!

children.heading: Mistake 2: Using で instead of と
children.content: Wrong: 「はい」で言った ❌ Right: 「はい」と言った ✓ "Said 'yes'" Use と for quotations!

children.heading: Mistake 3: Wrong word order
children.content: Wrong: という田中人 ❌ Right: 田中という人 ✓ "A person called Tanaka" Name comes before という

children.heading: Quoting questions
children.content: 彼は「行く？」と聞いた "He asked 'Are you going?'" 先生は「分かりますか」と言った "The teacher said 'Do you understand?'"

children.heading: Quoting commands
children.content: 母は「早く寝なさい」と言った "Mom said 'Go to sleep early'" 上司は「頑張れ」と言ってくれた "My boss said 'Do your best'"

children.heading: Converting to indirect
children.content: Direct: 彼は「行く」と言った Indirect: 彼は行くと言った "He said he would go" Drop quotation marks Adjust pronouns if needed

children.heading: と言った (said)
children.content: 彼は来ると言った "He said he would come" 「ありがとう」と言った "Said 'thank you'" Past speech

children.heading: と言っていた (was saying)
children.content: 彼は来ると言っていた "He was saying he would come" Ongoing past statement

children.heading: ～と言わない (doesn't say)
children.content: 彼は何も言わない "He doesn't say anything" 嘘だとは言わなかった "Didn't say it was a lie"

children.heading: Casual: と言う
children.content: 行くと言った "Said he'd go"

children.heading: Polite: と言います
children.content: 行くと言いました "Said he'd go"

children.heading: Humble: と申す
children.content: 田中と申します "My name is Tanaka" (humble) Very formal self-introduction

children.heading: Explaining terms
children.content: 「寿司」というのは、日本の料理です "'Sushi' is Japanese food" 愛というのは難しい "Love is difficult" (the thing called love)

children.heading: 何て言う？ (What do you call it?)
children.content: これ、日本語で何て言う？ "What do you call this in Japanese?" あの人、何て言う人？ "What's that person called?"

children.heading: ～と言っても (Even though I say/Even if)
children.content: 簡単と言っても、難しい "Even though I say it's easy, it's difficult"

children.heading: ～と言うか (Or rather/Or should I say)
children.content: 面白いと言うか、変な映画だった "It was interesting, or rather, a strange movie"

children.heading: ～と言っていた
children.content: 彼は忙しいと言っていた "He said he was busy" みんな楽しかったと言っていました "Everyone said it was fun"

children.heading: Describing unfamiliar things
children.content: 納豆という食べ物 "A food called natto" 相撲という スポーツ "A sport called sumo" Introducing concepts

children.heading: With unknown people
children.content: 鈴木さんという方 "Someone called Mr. Suzuki" 山田という学生 "A student named Yamada"

children.heading: Topic transition
children.content: 日本と言えば、寿司が有名だ "Speaking of Japan, sushi is famous" 夏と言えば、海だね "Speaking of summer, it's the sea"

children.heading: って (Casual と言う)
children.content: 彼って、誰？ "Who's he?" (lit: the one called he) 明日行くって "(He) says he's going tomorrow" Very casual

children.heading: と聞く (hear that)
children.content: 彼は来ると聞いた "I heard he's coming" 雨だと聞きました "I heard it's rain"

children.heading: と伝える (convey that)
children.content: よろしくと伝えてください "Please convey my regards"

children.heading: Basic
children.content: 彼は「はい」と言った "He said 'yes'" 田中という人を知っていますか "Do you know a person called Tanaka?" これは何と言いますか "What do you call this?"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: 先生は明日テストがあると言っていました "The teacher said there would be a test tomorrow" 「頑張って」と言われて、嬉しかった "I was happy when they said 'Do your best'" 京都という古い都市を訪れたい "I want to visit an old city called Kyoto"

children.heading: Advanced
children.content: 彼は「もう二度と会わない」と言って、 出て行ってしまった。その言葉が 今でも心に残っている。 "He said 'I'll never see you again' and left. Those words still remain in my heart." 日本には「おもてなし」という文化があります。 これは、お客様を心から歓迎し、 丁寧にもてなすという意味です。 "In Japan, there's a culture called 'omotenashi.' This means welcoming guests from the heart and treating them politely."

sections.heading: Related Grammar Points
sections.content: という - Called/that (contracted) って - Casual quotation と聞く - Hear that と思う - Think that Reported speech - Quoting others Quotation particle と - Quotation uses
